results.title: Pleasure Domes
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Maggie Fooke
results.brief_description: Is Cannes really like St Kilda, or is it just a state of mind? Animated watercolour drawings and handcoloured photocopies of photographs shape this introspective reflection on the nature of landscape and the human response to it. Technically impressive, atmospherically scored and quite hypnotic in its effect, this is a very distinguished work.

results.title: Please look after this bear
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Presents an animated adaptation of Chapter I of the book “A Bear called Paddington” by Michael Bond. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Animation by Ivor Wood. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Please don't pick the daisies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
The Snowy Mountains of South East Australia, despite their rugged, unchanging appearance are, in reality, quite fragile and quite sensitive to the forces of nature and the presence of people. The wild beauty of Kosciusko’s alpine flora is recorded by a research team for a new book.

results.title: Please can I come tomorrow? (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A child is not born with a comprehension of miracles. Education should be tailored to his level of comprehension - his experiences with play and people. This film examines nursery school in some depth to see how a child in particular and society as a whole can benefit from them.

results.title: Pleasantville
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Jon Kilik, Robert J. Degus, Steven Soderbergh and Gary Ross
results.brief_description: Dejected teenager David (Tobey Maguire) suffers all the complexities of 90s adolescence. Confronted by doomsaying school teachers and dwindling job prospects, David seeks refuge in his favourite TV show - an old-fashioned, black and white sitcom called Pleasantville. One fateful night a mysterious TV repairman transports David and his precocious sister Jennifer (Reese Witherspoon) inside the fantastic world of Pleasantville, where life is a curious routine of niceties and home-spun values. But the pair’s arrival turns everyday life on its head for the small town, until now untouched by concepts of sex, rebellion, and most notably, colour. An insightful satire of the American Dream, Pleasantville combines pioneering photographic techniques with a stellar cast including Joan Allen, J.T. Walsh, William H. Macy, Jeff Daniels and comic legend Don Knotts as the elusive TV repairman.

results.title: Plaza = The Beach
results.creator_credit: Studio Malych Form Filmowych Se-Ma-For, Andrzej Jozwikiewicz and Edward Sturlis
results.brief_description: Two cheeky tattoos escape from the chests of two sailors to wreak havoc on unsuspecting sunbathers, returning when the pace of their pranks gets out of hand. A comic short film, effectively combining real life with animation.

results.title: Playtime [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Specta Films, Rene Silvera and Jacques Tati
results.brief_description: The third of Tati’s films to feature the gangling form of Monsieur Hulot, “Playtime” is a surreal, comic vision of mankind’s battle against the overwhelming depersonalisation of modern city life. Filmed upon one of the most ambitious and imaginative sets ever to grace the screen, Tati’s cinematic magnum opus took three years and a reported one million pounds to shoot. The result is a startling triumph acclaimed by the international media as Tati’s finest work. Also available on VHS [302002].
